article.title: Magnetic Properties of One-Dimensional Quantum Spin System Rb2Cu2Mo3O12 Studied by Muon Spin Relaxation

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the lack of significant change in the ZF-µSR time spectra below 20 K in Figure 1 indicate about the magnetic ground state of Rb<sub>2</sub>Cu<sub>2</sub>Mo<sub>3</sub>O<sub>12</sub>?
What is the dominant behavior observed in the temperature dependence of the muon spin relaxation rate (λ) above 5 K in Figure 2(a)?
choices: λ shows a peak at a specific temperature.

multiple_choice_question.text: In Figure 3(f), what does the drop in the relaxation rate (λ) for the LF-independent component around 10 K suggest about the spin state of Rb<sub>2</sub>Cu<sub>2</sub>Mo<sub>3</sub>O<sub>12</sub>?
In formula (1), what does the term G<sub>KT</sub>(Δ, t) represent?
